document.ModsDocTitle: Three new species of eriophyoid mites (Acari, Eriophyoidea) associated with Lauraceae in China
document.docAuthor: Wang, Qiong, Han, Xiao, Xue, Xiao-Feng & Hong, Xiao-Yue
document.docTitle: Gammaphytoptus striatilobus Wang, Han, Xue & Hong, 2014, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of eriophyoid mites (Acari, Eriophyoidea) associated with Lauraceae in China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of eriophyoid mites (Acari, Eriophyoidea) associated with Lauraceae in China

caption.paragraph: Figure 2. Gammaphytoptus striatilobus sp. n.: D dorsal view of female em empodium IG female internal genitalia GM male genital region.

Figure 3. Gammaphytoptus striatilobus sp. n.: AL lateral view of anterior body region LO lateral view of annuli PM lateral view of posterior opisthosoma CGF female coxae and genitalia L1 leg I L2 leg II.
Figure 4. Gammaphytoptus striatilobus sp. n.: A coxae and female genitalia B prodorsal shield C female internal genitalia D leg I and leg II E male genitalia F empodium.

subSubSection.paragraph: Holotype female (slide number NJAUAcariEriHN128C.1; marked Holotype), from Phoebe hunanensis Hand.-Mazz. ( Lauraceae ), Zhangjiajie National Forest Park, Zhangjiajie City, Hunan Province, P.R. China, 29°20'41"N , 110°27'33"E , elevation 420m, 10 July 2013, coll. Qiong Wang, Xiao Han and Jingfeng Guo, deposited as a slide mounted specimen in the Arthropod/Mite Collection of the Department of Entomology, NJAU, Jiangsu Province, China. Paratypes 10 females and 7 males on 17 microscope slides (slide number NJAUAcariEriHN128C.2-128C.18), with the same data as holotype.
This species is vagrant on lower part of the leaf surface. No damage to the host plant was observed.
The specific designation "striatilobus" is from the character of prodorsal shield lobe ( "lobus" ) marked with parellel fine impressed lines ( "striatus" ), masculine in gender.
